actual.value: By December 2018. Puntland and Somaliland prisons were in line with minimum international norms and standards. UNODC delivered capacity-building support to the Custodial Corps in both Garowe (Puntland) and Hargeisa (Somaliland) prisons through provision of infrastructure. equipment. mentoring and ad hoc training.

title.narrative: Equipment, welfare, consumables and training provided in Garowe Prison.

This includes equipment (security equipment provided, shields, phone detectors, boots, database system, biometric registration, Id printers, it equipment), welfare (Vocational items for training in masonry, plumbing, electricity and carpentry. Sports equipment and schemes for physical training provided, including balls, shoes, uniforms, building courts to the activities, etc. Educational services to teach basic literacy and math provided to all prisoners), consumables (Provision of food supplements for all prisoners, basic medical care and medicine provided. Welfare items such as matrasses, sheets, praying mats), training (Training will include courses for all officers on minimum standards and human right, operational routines, riot control, searching strategies. Security department will receive dynamic security. Operations and maintenance team trained to provide a sustainable way of maintaining the physical structures of the prison. Leadership training for prison management

Project targets 50 people in Somaliland and Puntland

actual.value: The project developed tailored capacity building programmes to meet the development needs of its beneficiaries such as the Management Development Programme and Senior Management programme delivered in Hargeisa and Garowe. Remarkably. the capacity building offered at the Garowe Training Academy has been extended to all Federal Member states making it under Commissioner General Bashir the Federal Training Academy for the whole of Somalia. Also supported through this contribution. the Federal Training Academy offered capacity building activities to five FMS supporting the establishment of a Federal Corrections system.

A target of 250 prison officials have been trained in proper techniques for care of prisoners in Puntland and Somaliland respectively

actual.value: custodial officers from South and Central Somalia were trained by the resident trainers and our mentors in preparation for the opening of the Mogadishu Prison and Court Complex (MPCC). Fifty cadets received a two-week training on general duties. including admission and administration. legal framework. chain of command and crisis management. radio communication. practical exercises in search techniques. corruption and nepotism. prisoner categorisation. managing vulnerable groups of inmates. managing violent extremist in-mates. dynamic security. and self-defence. An additional six colleagues of the cadets received specialised training on database management.
